newsitem.title: INDONESIA: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 7.
newsitem.headline: INDONESIAN STOCKS - factors to watch - Oct 7.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors likely to affect Indonesian stocks on Monday:

** The Dow Jones industrial average rallied 60.01 points, or 1.01 percent, to a record closing high of 5,992.86 on Friday as a surprisingly weak September jobs report eased fears of an interest rate hike by the Federal Reserve.
** Indonesia's plywood exports to Japan saw an 11 percent increase in the first nine months of this year and are expected to continue rising until next year.
** The Jakarta Composite Index fell 1.44 points to close at 588.35 points on Friday following some profit-taking in selected heavyweights and secondaries.
** On Monday, the Indonesian rupiah was at 2,323.20/23.40 in early trading against an opening of 2,322.50/23.50.
** Barito Pacific, Sumalindo Lestari, on reports that a number of timber firms were facing a shortage in raw material, and higher exports to Japan.
** Automotive parts manufacturer Prima Alloy on market talk of expected higher earnings in 1996 due to rising overseas demand.
** Glass manufacturer Mulia Industri on market talk of a possible private placement.
** Duta Pertiwi on market talk the property firm was likely to issue convertible bonds for further expansion.
** Duta Anggada Realty on fresh market talk that the property firm was in negotiations with another new foreign property firm on possible joint venture
** Sampoerna on reports of a $400-million loan for "corporate development"
